New Records: Freddie Freeman became the first player in World Series history to hit a walk-off grand slam, breaking the tie in the bottom of the 10th inning.
Key Match Events: Freddie Freeman's walk-off grand slam in the 10th inning ended the game and secured the Dodgers' 6-3 victory.
The game went into extra innings with a dramatic finish after being tied 2-2 through nine innings.
Jazz Chisholm's leadoff single in the 10th inning and subsequent stolen bases set up the Yankees' 3-2 lead before the Dodgers tied it again.
A fan interfered with a ground-rule double call in the ninth inning, leading to a review and keeping the game tied.
Pre-Game Insights: The pregame ceremony honored the late Fernando Valenzuela with a memorial on the field at Dodger Stadium.
Brad Paisley performed the National Anthem, and fans turned out in large numbers for the game.

Both teams were highlighted for their patient and powerful lineups, with key players like Shohei Ohtani, Freddie Freeman, Mookie Betts, Aaron Judge, and Giancarlo Stanton expected to play significant roles.
Post-Match Reflections: Aaron Judge expressed pride in the Yankees' comeback and resilience after the loss.
Manager Aaron Boone praised the effort and determination of his team despite the tough loss.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Dodger Stadium's concourses were unusually crowded, reflecting the high interest in the game.
Gerrit Cole and Jack Flaherty, both key pitchers, had strong performances, with Flaherty throwing five scoreless innings and Cole allowing just three runs over six innings.
Others: The game marked the first World Series meeting in 43 years between the Dodgers and Yankees, reigniting a historic rivalry.
The game was a historic one, featuring multiple MVP candidates and significant achievements.
